properties.description: standardised creation of zendesk system extract table. Also 2 fucntion wich create the custom fields and fields from the nested columns from the system extract table.

source: The purpose of the notebook is to load all export json files from  the blob storage into a spark dataframe, add the needed columns and create the placeholder table for the standardised layer.
The notebooks also create 2 harmonised tables from the which hold the id and case reference data from each zendesk ticket

from collections.abc import Mapping
from itertools import chain
from operator import add
#ignore FutureWarning messages 
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", message="iteritems is deprecated")
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from pprint import pprint as pp
import json
import pyspark.sql.functions as F 
import pandas as pd
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
storage_acc_name = spark.sparkContext.environment.get('dataLakeAccountName', 'get')
mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/zendesk_items") 
mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
"abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/ZenDesk/Export/",
"/zendesk_items", 
{"linkedService":"ls_storage"}

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate() 
storage_acc_name = spark.sparkContext.environment.get('dataLakeAccountName', 'get')
shows = spark.read.json("abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/ZenDesk/Export/output_*.json",multiLine=True)

from pyspark.sql.functions import lit
from pyspark.sql.functions import row_number
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.window import Window
partition = Window.partitionBy("SourceSystemID").orderBy('id')
# add ingested date to df
pandasDF = shows.toPandas()
pandasDF = pandasDF.applymap(str)
sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(pandasDF) 
sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("SourceSystemID",lit(6)).withColumn('IngestionDate', F.current_timestamp()).withColumn('ValidTo', lit("NULL")).withColumn('IsActive', lit("Y")).withColumn('RowID', row_number().over(partition))
# sparkDF.show(10)

#delete and create table 
spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_standardised_db.zendesk_system_extract;")
sparkDF.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_standardised_db.zendesk_system_extract")
